metadata.dc:author: Yamrozik, June
Biederman, Robert W
Rathi, Vikas
Willians, Ronald
Fernandes, Andre Mauricio
metadata.dc:description: Interrupted inferior vena cava (IVC) is a rare anomaly. Anomalies of IVC are clinically important for cardiologists and radiologists who plan to intervene in the right heart. We describe three cases of IVC interruption diagnosed by cardiac magnetic resonance imaging study.
metadata.dc:title: Cardiovascular magnetic resonance in unsuspected interrupted inferior vena cava.
